data.title: Niantic, Inc.
data.meta_description: Niantic, Inc. | 98,126 followers on LinkedIn. Building technologies and ideas that move us as the leaders in Augmented Reality | Niantic inspires people to explore the world, together. Our mission is to use emerging augmented reality (AR) technology to enrich our experiences as human beings in the physical world. Originally formed at Google in 2011, we are now an independent company with a strong group of investors including Nintendo, The Pok√©mon Company, and Alsop Louie Partners.
data.text:
Empowering future tech leaders with Mission Bit! üöÄThis summer, we at Niantic were thrilled to partner with Mission Bit, an organization committed to bridging the tech divide by providing free computer science education to high school students in the Bay Area. Together, we aimed to inspire and empower the next generation of tech leaders. üó£Ô∏è As part of our collaboration, we hosted a career talk with a panel of Niantic employees, sharing insights and experiences from various roles within our company. Our team members were excited to connect with these bright, aspiring students, offering guidance and answering their questions about careers in technology. üöå In addition, we had the pleasure of welcoming Mission Bit students to our office for an immersive field trip. They explored our work environment, learned about our projects, and experienced life at Niantic. It was a fantastic opportunity for the students to see the potential career paths available to them and to envision themselves in the tech industry. ü§ù We believe in the power of education and mentorship to create meaningful opportunities for young people. Our partnership with Mission Bit is a testament to our commitment to fostering diversity and inclusion within the tech community. ‚ù§Ô∏è Thank you, Mission Bit, for your dedication to empowering youth and for allowing us to be part of this incredible journey. We look forward to more collaborations in the future! #Niantic #MissionBit #TechEducation #YouthEmpowerment #STEM #CareerTalk #FieldTrip #Inspiration #DiversityInTech

Catch Niantic, Inc. Research at #CVPR2024! - I will give a talk at the MonoDepth challenge, TUE-PM. Teaser below! Wonder how depth estimation can do more for AR than realistic occlusions? Event page: https://lnkd.in/edgYHXKZ - We present MicKey WED-PM in üì£ oral üì£ session 2C and at poster PS-2-2. Metric relative poses from two RGB images. More info: https://lnkd.in/emjmKws3 - Also on WED-PM: AirPlanes - planar reconstructions of 3D scenes. Poster PS-2-42. More info: https://lnkd.in/ejQEu89b - One more poster FRI-AM: marepo ( ‚ú® Highlight ‚ú® ) - accurate visual relocalisation using a scene-agnostic pose regressor. Poster PS-5-108. More info: https://lnkd.in/e39mcBgc Work by: Axel Barroso Laguna, Sowmya Munukutla, Victor Adrian Prisacariu, Eric Brachmann, Jamie Watson, Filippo Aleotti, Mohamed Sayed, Zawar Qureshi, Oisin Mac Aodha, Gabriel Brostow, Michael Firman, Sara Vicente, Tommaso Cavallari, Shuai Chen and supported by many more at Niantic, Inc.!

To date, NPF has helped 5,000 young people earn their Junior Ranger Angler badge! NPF is excited to introduce this year‚Äôs cohort of Junior Ranger Angler grantees: https://lnkd.in/egzgRVfE
